meanings.definition: Attempting to impress by affecting greater importance, talent, culture, etc., than is actually possessed.
meanings.sent1: The man's pretentious behavior made everyone roll their eyes.
meanings.sent2: She always wore pretentious clothes to make herself seem more sophisticated.
meanings.sent3: His pretentious speech about his 'vast knowledge' was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The pretentious facade he put up crumbled when faced with reality.
meanings.sent5: The pretentious display of wealth did little to hide his insecurities.

meanings.definition: Characterized by assumption of dignity or importance, especially when exaggerated or undeserved.
meanings.sent1: The pretentious lady acted as if she were royalty.
meanings.sent2: His pretentious attitude towards others made him unpopular.
meanings.sent3: The pretentious peacock strutted around the farm as if he owned it.
meanings.sent4: Her pretentious claims of superiority were quickly debunked.
meanings.sent5: The pretentious air of the mansion intimidated visitors.

meanings.definition: Making an exaggerated outward show; ostentatious.
meanings.sent1: The pretentious decorations at the party were over the top.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant's pretentious menu made simple dishes sound fancy.
meanings.sent3: The pretentious car with its gold-plated rims turned heads on the street.
meanings.sent4: Her pretentious gestures were a cover for her lack of confidence.
meanings.sent5: The pretentious display of wealth was met with skepticism by the townspeople.
